intro: Adenocalymma laevigatum, commonly known as the smooth-flowered adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or scrub habitats. Adenocalymma laevigatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
